line.en: 'Well, Ageha, see you tomorrow.'
'I'm back!'
Ageha's yell fills me to the brim.
Looks like the dormitory work will come first.
But I'll be sidestepping everyone today so few\nare here today.
Asa and Yoru spend their weekends at home, while\nKotori is eating out with Hibari.
'I'm baaaaack... And I'm huuuuungry!'
'Okay okay, I'll get right on it.'
'Did everything go okay with Ageha?'
'Barely avoided a witch hunt, but whose fault do\nyou think it was?'
'Ugh, aren't you just the lady-killer, Aoi.'
'I wonder if it's okay for me to get angry now?'
'Welcome home.'
'Hey, here I am.'
Huh... Now...
Umm, I think I'll wash the potatoes and carrots\nfirst...
'I'll get to work on the chicken over here.'
'Oh, you're a lifesaver.'
'Mmm, smells good.'
'I'm so hungry.'
'Isn't the rice ready yet?'
I swung the pot around to deliver a pile of food\non to a large plate, a giant cloud of steam\nfollowing it all the way to the table.
'Looks good.'
'How many pairs of chopsticks?'
'We need 7.'
'Are we all here? Well then...'
'Let's eat!'
'Chomp chomp, munch much.'
'Mmm, this really turned out well.'
'The smell and the food... So good...'
'Umm, Kanako-san, is okay if I ask a question?'
'Sure, go ahead.'
'These two on my right and left... How long have\nthey been with me?'
'Ah, one has been with you from the start, and\nthe other has always clung to you from behind.'
'I see, I see.'
'Right! And what could it mean?'
'Umm, hasn't it already been said?'
'And that aside, aren't you going to eat?'
'We did bring you ingredients after all.'
'We also helped you cook.'
'It's fine. I got my permission, so eating here's\nnot a problem.'
'The problem is... why this seat?'
One side of the table was Kanako and everyone\nelse from the dorm.
And then there was me.
Sitting in the middle on the side opposite from\nher.
Ageha on my right and Hotaru on my left.
'Looks like you have a flower in each hand.'
'Must be nice to be surrounded such cuties.'
'Aoi's sure living the dream, isn't he?'
'Trust me! It's not all it's cracked up to be!'
'If you're not going to eat your food, I will.'
'Aoi, do you need seconds?'
'I'll give him this instead.'
'Ah, I guess I'll do the same.'
'Open wide Aoi, the airplane's coming in for a\nlanding.'
'Who's eating?'
'Aoi, say AAAAHHHHH.'
'No, I mean...'
'No?'
'Oooo...'
'C'mon Aoi, you need to work on being a better\nhost. So turn this way, and say AAAAAHHHHH.'
'Ryouko, take a good one.'
'Yes, of course, I've got this.'
'What are you doing with that camera?'
'Umm... we're going to sell it to the Newspaper\nClub to earn funds for the club, right?'
'No, no, send it to Aunt Minase. Aoi can't afford\nto take his 'lady friend' out on a date, so we\nneed to get him some money.'
'If we go ahead with this, it may have the bonus\nof adding to the club's chest!'
'We'll rip them off for the whole sum!'
'That's Ageha for ya... one nasty girl.'
'C'mon... give me a bit more credit...'
'You sure are something, Ageha.'
'I don't want to drag everyone into this right\nnow, so we'll have a long talk about it later.'
'Aoi will fight on my behalf.'
'No fair! Not while I'm around!'
'I'd kind of like to eat, but...'
'Good idea! Eat before it gets cold. '
'Please stop already!'
'The tears of others taste sweet...'
'Your sister has some harsh lessons to teach.'
'Aoi's tears taste like iron...'
'Ah, right, that's because blood is full of iron.\nSo is that cause enough for us to show\nrestraint!?'
'Aoi looks like he's about to shed tears of his\nown.'
'Jeez, I wonder who's to blame!'
'It's you Aoi, right Hotaru?'
'Yes.'
'What's this sudden collusion!?'
'It's like I said already. Just stop looking at\nme like that with those grins on your faces!'
'Nah, I mean, look, it's like, are you trying to\nsay that we're in your way?'
'In a perfect world...'
'They're sisters. Or should I say sister sandwich\nwith Aoi here?'
'It's not like that!'
Ah... I've had about enough of this for one\nday...
'Well then, thanks for the food! I'll see you all\nlater!'
'Okay, great job today. Are you coming too? I'll\nprepare some notes for you if you do.'
'Thanks in advance!'
'Going to cram for exams... huh?'
'Yeah.'
'Can I... join too?'
'Hmm? Well, I don't mind, but...?'
'I'll go then.'
Hotaru spoke with unusual intensity.
'C'mon, Hotaru, you're not even in the same\ngrade.'
She has a point. With us in year 3 and the\nKazato\sisters in year 1, there isn't much for\nHotaru to gain as the only 2nd year student.
'But if she wants to come, she's welcome.'
'I'm going.'
Hotaru again spoke with unusual intensity.
'Okay...'
After that... I saw the sisters off and returned\nhome...
'I'm back.'
'Weeeee'rrrrreeeee baaaaaaack!'
'I'm here too. Man, after hanging at home for a\nwhile, this place really starts to look like a\ndump.'
'Ah, get me some dessert. Fruits would be nice. I\nwonder what you all have.'
Overtaken by a new source of fatigue, I felt my\nshoulders buckle beneath an invisible weight.
Uh... It's morning... I have to get up...
I wake up and start cramming for exams. I need to\nmake up some notes for everyone soon...
But first, I need to clean the bathroom and do\nsome errands for my dorm mother...
This is bad. I managed to get up but I'm still\nsleepy...
However, the sleepiness I feel is pleasant and I\nam unable to resist it...
'Look, he's asleep.'
'He sure is.'
'If we're going to do it, now's our chance.'
'Yeah, let's do it.'
'Okay 'meat' is no good. We need some other word\nthat suits Aoi.'
'Okay. Leave it to me.'
Hmm... It's like... I think I just heard a\nfamiliar voice.
Is someone here...?
I felt something warm and soft inch closer to\nme...
'Hya!?'
Ah, it's even softer than I thought... incredibly\nsoft and sweet and aromatic... and it's more hot\nthan warm...
I wrap myself tightly around it.
'Aaaaah... No! S-stop! Aoi...!'
'Ugh... No good... Ah...'
Ahhh, this is heaven.
'Haaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa!!'
Huh, what an intense voice.

With vision blurred from sleep, I see what
appears to be someone flying through air. The
elbow is bent. Just when I thought it was at a
dangerous angle, it came crashing down on my
stomach.
'Oof!?'
Having received the sudden shock... I lapsed back\ninto unconsciousness.
'Phew...'
Oh no, I overslept.
Everybody else must be up already.
'You're late.'
'Sorry.'
'Ah, you're finally awake.'
'Oh, so you came.'
'Ugh... so now he's up.'
Which reminds me, why is it that, whenever I look\nat Ageha... I feel a sharp pain in my stomach?
'G-good morning... Aoi...'
'Oh, you're here. Let's have fun... another day.\nThis day is reserved for studying.'
'No problem!'
'Huh, what's wrong? Do you have a fever or\nsomething? Your face is kind of red.'
'Uh, no... this is... something else...'
'Hmm.'
Ageha belt her elbow in a show of support.
Just seeing her pointed elbow was enough to send\nshivers down my spine.
What is going on here?
We've got more enough chairs to jump right into\nstudying.
'Okay everyone. Let's do everyone in our power to\nnot fail these exams.'
A failing grade would mean supplementary lessons\nthat seriously threaten the 'break' part of\nsummer break.
In that case, the teachers who are forced to be\npresent for those lessons lose their summers too.
Teachers who lose time for holidays, family and\nhobbies tend to reveal a more sinister form, not\noften seen during normal classes.
'Failure means death! So declares your leader!'
We, too, could not stand the idea of losing\nprecious working hours.
That's why all of us got together to study for\nthese exams as if our lives depended on it.
Our school is fairly industrial in nature with an\nunusually high number of marks awarded for\npractical skills.
On the other hand, general classes are not taken\nas seriously.
However, that doesn't mean those classes can be\nneglected...
More than anything, I'm just glad that normal\nclasses can be studied the night before.
'Hmm, I don't get this!'
'I guess it might be...'
Kotori was the expert when it came to written\nsubjects.
Ageha has skillful hands and a quick mind, but\nunfortunately for her, neither of these seemed to\ntranslate to the test sheet.
That's why, in a complete reversal of what\nhappens when they're making the glider, Ageha\nlistened intently to Kotori's instruction.
'Okay, what about this one?'
'Draw a red line from this point to that one, and\njust try to commit this much to your memory.'
'That teacher tends to recycle tests, so there's\nan 80 percent chance the new test will be an old\none.'
'Got it.'
'If only Yoru could take my test for me...'
'Well, you're doing this, because you know I\ncan't! Ugh, you're completely hopeless!'
'Calm down, calm down.'
'For whose benefit are we doing this?!'
...Well, I suppose we should just leave those two\nto their own stuff.
On the other hand, I could really use some of\nYoru's instruction myself...

Well, I've held my own in information-based
subjects in the past. While an easy victory by no
means, I don't see a particular need to panic for
the time being.
Which means I at least have enough wiggle room to\nsee to the studies of a second year student in\nneed.
'Do you need any help with anything?'
'Yes... This one...'
'Ah, physics... I see. Start by memorizing this\nformula.'
'Keep both this and this in mind. Remember\nwhatever you can. If you can apply them, you\nshould get the main point one way or another.'
'Okay...'
'Give it a try for yourself. I think you can use\nthat formula on questions 2 and 3.'
'Hotaru?'
'Yes?'
'What's wrong? You seem hesitant...'
'No, I don't think it's that...'
'Well then, look.'
'Okay...'
I slowly move Hotaru's hand over the notebook.
Her hands sure are small...
'What's wrong?'
'Aoi... your arms... you have so much muscle...'
'Ah, that's from all the biking I did. I'd be\nworried if you had thought the same back when I\nwas a skinny little runt.'
'Wow... you're just so powerful, so strong.'
'Ah. ...did you say... powerful?'
Have I ever shown Hotaru a display of strength\\nbefore?
'Your grip. It was so strong.'
'Grip...'
A huge question mark appeared above my head.
'That was dangerous.'
'What was?'
'That was... for me.'
'It would have been far worse if I hadn't been\nable to stop Ageha in time.'
'Umm... What are you talking about?'
'Your grip.'
'Umm... I really have no idea what you're getting\non about, but...'
'Look. How about this?'
'Wow... This one is tough.'
The two of them over there are looking this way\nas they smile and exchange whispers.
'What are you up to over there?'
'Nothing, nothing at all.'
'Nope, not a thing. Heheheh.'
'Uh-huh.'
I overlooked the open reference book, notebook...\nand my cell phone, which was placed under the\ncover of their shadows.
'That. What is that?'
'Don't worry, it's nothing.'
'I told you nothing's going on... hehehehe.'
'You two are being incredibly suspicious.'
'Ageha, did you already delete the one from\nbefore?'
'You fool, Hotaru!'
I reached out my arm and grabbed hold of Ageha's\ncell phone.

Ageha tried to guard against my advance, but I
was faster. I'd be concerned if my reaction speed
were to have lost out considering the days of
hard training I'd dedicated myself to.
'Stop! Don't look!'
'Ageha Himegi, I have a question for you.'

'This screen is displaying what appears from
below to be nostrils in a picture that seems like
it was taken at a deliberately awkward angle.
Who, if I may ask, is the sleeping boy in this
picture?'
'It's Aoi Minase! Haha! Hoohoo! Don't kill me!'
'Hotaru, I'll leave this with you. Take as many\nphotos of the insidious life form over there as\nyou can while it's still here.'
'Roger that.'
'Traitor!'
'Sorry Ageha. I have no choice.'
'Ah, no pictures, no pictures please. You'll need\nto ask my manager. No. Don't. The sheer beauty of\nmy face'll break the lens.'
'Do you even understand what you're saying?'
'That I'm the best of the best?'
'Well, you get an F for language.'
'You can pose for the camera, you know.'
'Well, aren't I versatile?'
'Or maybe you mean volatile.'
'Either-or!'
'There's no room for leniency.'
'Understood.'
'Ah, you've come to take my picture! Such beauty!\nSuch style! You won't want to miss an inch of\nit!'
'She's sure in high spirits, isn't she?'
'Hey sister. Don't grow up to be like that.'
'She's definitely not a good role model. I'll do\nmy best Yoru.'
'It seems the value has inadvertently shot\ndownward! It's falling!'
'It'll shoot back up the day after tomorrow,\nbecause you're trying to avoid the issue of the\noriginal picture.'
'Have I been exposed!?'
'Hotaru, where did this picture come from?'
'I took it earlier.'
'Hey!'
'Which reminds me, you were already here when I\nwoke up.'
'Hmm. The door was unlocked.'
'Huh!? The front door!?'
'The rear window.'
'What!?'
'Yesterday, Kanako-san said I should sneak in on\nthe way home.'
'She did...!?'
'What did you plan to do after sneaking in?'
'Hotaru, it's best if you don't know.'
'Can you take a hint that those two probably\nshouldn't know either?'
'Hey, what did you plan to do after sneaking in?'
'Maybe she wanted to crawl through the darkness.'
'Ah, so she was launching a surprise attack of\nsome kind.'
'...Maybe I should try phrasing it another way.'
'I think you're close enough.'
'... Well then, what did the two Himegi sisters\nplan to do after sneaking into my room?'
'Nothing, we just wanted to hit the books early.'
'The Aoi observation diary.'
'No way!'
'First, we wanted to write something on your\nforehead.'
'Meat?'
'We wrote both Ageha's and my name.'
'Graffiti!'
'We didn't have enough room to write all of the\nletters, so combined them into a single nickname\nto represent us.'
'Ah, so you wrote 'stupid'...'
'Ahhhhhhhhhh!'
'It's fine! We used water-based markers, it faded\nquickly and is already gone.'
'Obviously!'
'Maybe we should have used oil-based?'
'That's not what I'm getting at!'
'You're a wild one, Aoi.'
'Sorry, just be quiet for a second.'
'But doesn't your attack on Hotaru cancel out the\nwhole picture fiasco?'
'...Who attacked who?'
'Hotaru was attacked by...'
'Aoi.'
'Gyahh...'
'...I wonder if he's trying to feign surprise.'
Gee, thanks for your trust, friend.
'What are you talking about!?'
'I was grabbed.'
'That's right. As if she were passing prey, he\njumped up and grabbed her like a trapdoor\nspider... so irrational.'
'I think you mean 'irritating', but...'
'That's right, his arm shot up and caught\nHotaru.'
'I can't say anything.'
'What do you mean?'
'Hairiness.'
'I find it to be rude, creepy, and extremely\nscary.'
'I see...'
'Your senior has no dignity...'
'That's why I sprung into action! My sister was\nin danger! I immediately unleashed an elbow drop\non him!'
I remembered what I saw from behind my eyelids.\nAgeha floating in air. Her pointed elbow. I can\nstill see her falling down on me...
'That really happened!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!'
'Well, it turned out that an elbow was the\ncorrect response.'
'Heeeeeeeeeeey!!'
'I've had it up to here with you Ageha!'
I took a bathroom break to try to get my head on\nstraight.
'What a busy day.'
'I have something I need to talk to you about\nlater. I'm going to need to put you on the spot.'
'Ah, you found out?'
'Crime prevention and public morals are serious\nissues!'
'Ah, so you're angry.'
'I am!'
'You're lucky that it was only the sisters that\ncame in today. What am I going to do if a\nstranger comes in!?'
'Well, okay, I'm sorry. It won't happen again.'
'If you want to sneak into my place, just call\nand I'll be sure to leave the door unlocked.'
'That's not what this is about!'
'I'm so very sorry. I hope you'll accept my\nhumble apology.'
'Ugh! Stop already!'
'Hehehe, catch me if you caaaaan.'
'... I guess I wouldn't chase you... so you'd\nprobably escape. Ah, enough already.'
My stomach felt as if the Morning Glory was\nwinding through it.
I took that as a sign that I should grab\nnotebooks from other subjects and head back to my\nroom.
'This... This is... Hmm.'
Feeling a presence, I turned around.
'Hotaru?'
'Sorry about Ageha.'
'It's fine. It's not your place to apologize.'
'But I didn't stop her, because seeing you asleep\nmade my heart race.'
'Hey now...'
Hotaru's eyes were oddly wet, her eyes turned to\nthe\ bed behind me.
'You caught me and grabbed me in your arms.'
'Sorry. It didn't hurt, did it? I have a feeling\nI used all of my strength.'
'Nope. It really didn't hurt at all.'
'It was a little tight... but it was also really\nhot, my heart raced, and I was close enough to\nsmell you.'
'Wow... I've heard enough... that was bad. That\nwas really really bad!'
As if she had just eaten something delicious,\nHotaru's cheeks turned red, and put out her hands\nin a trance.
Wha, What are you thinking about?
'... Aoi, have you done the same to Ageha too?'
'Wha!?'
By done... Is she referring to what she just told\nme about?
Half-asleep, I pulled Ageha in and...
For a moment, I forgot where I was.
I was filled with a strange imagination,\ndelusions and consciousness.
'No no no no no no no!'
Feeling as if I were flying in a strange\ndirection, I suddenly came back to my senses with\na crash landing.
'No never! I'd never do that! Never!'
'So you haven't done it to her yet...'
'And I won't ever do it!'
'You won't?'
'I won't!'
I state it assertively. I would collapse and die\nif it happened.
'Haa, haa... You shouldn't mock adults.'
'You and I are only separated by year.'
'A year is a year.'
'Mmm... I'll be just like Ageha this time next\nyear...'
Umm... Hotaru, you're giving me a massage?
'Well, Aoi... are you saying you don't want a\nmassage from me?'
'From you?'
Hotaru nodded.
'Or maybe I should go meet up with Ageha?'
'No... You don't have to... do that...'
'I just wanted to spend some time with you\none-on-one.'
'We were never able to do that in the past...'
'Right now, I'm older than Ageha was back then.'
'Well, that's true I suppose.'
'I'm a great older sister...'
'So you say... But really?'
'Mmm.'
'Sorry sorry. You're absolutely right.'
'Mmm.'
'Well then, accept this massage from your older\nsister.'
'No complaints here.'
'It's just like we're adults or something.'
'I'll let you do your thing.'
Basically, this is going to get windy.
Maybe I should take up cycling again soon?
Being with Hotaru really takes the load off of my\nleg.
'However...'

After exams are over, I'm going to have to put
all of my energy into making the glider and
finishing it as soon as possible. And then the
test flights will begin...
Even if I hung out with Hotaru, it'd probably\nalways turn out the same.
... Just when I thought I'd try to tell her that.
'Hotaru? Aoi?'
Hearing that voice was enough to know who was\ncoming.
And here I was. With Hotaru. In my room. Just the\ntwo of us.
'Oh, Oooh! What's wrong!?'
'I was just taking a break and thought some\nwatermelon would be nice. Do you mind if I carve\none up?'
'That sounds great. I'm on my way.'
Replying through the door, I turned toward\nHotaru.
'Well then, let's go.'
Though it was my own voice, it sounded strangely\nhollow.
'Okay...'
Hotaru, as if she were looking in the opposite\ndirection, nodded without looking at me.
I had never seen Hotaru's face like that before\nand I remember having the uncomfortable feeling\nof not being able to say anything.
'Ah, there you are. Everyone was worried that you\nmight have gotten stuck in the toilet.'
'Nope! And besides, girls hardly have the right\nto complain about long bathroom breaks!'
'I suppose you'll be returning to a boys' school\nthen.'
'Don't talk to me like that!'
'Then stop having such silly illusions about\ngirls!'
'You with no illusions have no right to say\nthat.'
'Oh, that hurt... looks like somebody needs\nanother angry elbow!'
'I've already seen that technique!'
Ageha's diving elbow landed square in the palm of\nmy hand.
'Ouch!'
'That's right. It's the hardest part of the body\nand feels as such.'
'My hand. What am I going to do if it's hurt?'
'Tie a wire between your mouth and the flying\nequipment. I'll start working on it immediately.'
'I'm not string puppet, you know.'
'I'll carve the watermelon, but where's Hotaru?'
'Huh?'
I looked behind me, but she wasn't there.
'That's strange. I thought she was...'
'I'm here.'
'Wha!?'
Oh, that took me by surprise.
'Where were you?'
'I was rotating.'
'Well, anyway, we're going to have some\nwatermelon. Give me a hand.'
'Okay.'
I guess I was already used to her crazy speech\nand conduct, but Ageha quickly abandoned her\ninvestigation and went off with Hotaru.
'... Rotating...?'
Did Hotaru stay in the room after I left?
Was she... rotating there?
Maybe she was doing ballet?

Or perhaps gymnastics. A forward handstand would
involved rotating... Oh stop already, it's
impossible to imagine Hotaru doing something like
that.
The more I thought about it, the less it made\nsense.

When I was asked in front of everyone what I was
doing in my room, I didn't have an answer... next
time it's just the two of us, I guess I should
try to ask her.
The extremely long study session finally came to\nan end.
'Phew, I knew I'd be tired at after that.'
'Ooo, I can see comparative past-tense words\ncircling around my head like a whirlpool.'
'Calm down. You know what you want to say.'
'Get Amane for me. I think I'm going to have her\ntake the test in my place.'
'She's a teacher now, you know.'
'Aoi and I both share a fool's umbrella...'
Ah, it seems like Hotaru broke her silence.
'Please take them home.'
'I know.'
'Eheheheh... send them off with their escort...'
'Ha ha... you can doooo it Aooiiii.'
I honestly don't know how much more I can take of\nthese two.
'Well, here is fine. Thank you.'
'Oooh.'
'Thank you Aoi.'
'... Don't forget the promise.'
'Promise?'
'It's a secret.'
'Ah, you're clever, aren't you?'
'Sometimes I am.'
'That aside, do you know if Ageha deleted the\npicture?'
'Of course!'
'That was quick. Can I see your cell phone?'
'Nope! That would be a violation of my privacy!'
'Hotaru, please take a pic of Ageha looking\nstupid and send it to me.'
'Eeek, you're a creep! A creep I tell you!'
'I understand.'
'Traitor!'
'I've been Aoi's ally from the start.'
'Thank you, Hotaru.'
I patted her head.
'Mmm.'
'Ah, me too...'
'I think you're a bit old for that.'
'Are you saying I'm old!?'
'You're older than me, big sis.'
'Hmph, I know. I know that you like older women,\nAoi.'
'Oh, do you?'
'He is always tugging at Amane's skirt.'
'How many times do I have to tell you. That was\nan accident.'
'Hotaru, never forget. You can control a man with\nyour eyes.'
'I understand what you're getting at, but...'
'I get it. Aoi likes girls with big eyes.'
'You don't have to remember that!'
'They'll give up if you do! '
'It's okay. It's just status.'
'Hmph, don't you understand your own value!?'
'Can I go?'
'Thank you Aoi. I'll see you again tomorrow.'
'Oh. Say hi to your aunt and uncle for me.'
'Sure thing! '
'See you. Good luck on the test tomorrow.'
'Thanks. You too. Good luck.'
'Oh.'
'Hmm? What's wrong, Ageha?'
'Hmph!'
And just like that she disappeared into her\nhouse.
She stuck out her tongue as far as she could.
'What's with Ageha... making a fool out of me.'
'I wonder if most of the pictures were deleted. I\ncould never live with the embarrassment if those\nwere to get around.'
Angry... is how I guess I should feel.
'... Hehehe.'
I can't help but smile for some reason.
I have a feeling that 'hmph' washed everything\nelse away.
I rotated my neck and shoulders as I hopped\nlightly around the place.
'Okay! Time to head home!'
I jogged lightly back to my dorm.
Exams start tomorrow. Let's do this!
